articles.title: What is the Squires App?
articles.summary: Overview of the Squires digital forms management system.
articles.content_md:
# What is the Squires App?

The Squires App is a custom-built digital forms management system designed for A&V Squires Plant Co. Ltd. It replaces paper-based forms with a modern, mobile-first Progressive Web Application (PWA) accessible from any device.

## Key Features

- **Employee Timesheets** - Digital weekly timesheets with automatic hour calculations
- **Vehicle Inspections** - 26-point safety checklist system with photo uploads
- **RAMS Documents** - Risk Assessment & Method Statement management
- **Absence Management** - Request and track leave
- **Fleet Maintenance** - Track MOT, tax, service schedules
- **Workshop Tasks** - Manage vehicle repairs and work
- **Approvals** - Manager review and approval workflows
- **Reports** - Export data as PDF or Excel

## Access

The app is available at: https://avsworklog.mpdee.uk

It works on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. For the best mobile experience, add it to your home screen as a PWA.

articles.title: How do I log in?
articles.summary: Instructions for logging into the app.
articles.content_md:
# How do I log in?

1. Go to https://avsworklog.mpdee.uk
2. Enter your email address
3. Enter your password
4. Click **Sign In**

## First Time Login

If this is your first login, an admin will have created your account and sent you a temporary password by email. You'll be required to change this password on first login.

## Forgot Password?

Contact your administrator to reset your password. They can generate a new temporary password from the User Management page.

articles.title: How do I change my password?
articles.summary: Instructions for changing your password.
articles.content_md:
# How do I change my password?

If you need to change your password (either because it's your first login or you want to update it):

1. You'll be automatically redirected to the Change Password page if a change is required
2. Enter your new password (must meet security requirements)
3. Confirm the new password
4. Click **Change Password**

## Password Requirements

- Minimum length as set by system
- Should be unique and not easily guessed

## Forgot Your Password?

Ask your administrator to reset it from the User Management page.

articles.title: Understanding the Dashboard
articles.summary: Guide to the main dashboard and navigation.
articles.content_md:
# Understanding the Dashboard

The Dashboard is your home screen after logging in. It shows quick actions and important status information.

## Quick Actions (All Users)

Square buttons for common tasks based on your permissions:
- **Timesheets** - Create/view timesheets
- **Inspections** - Perform vehicle inspections
- **RAMS** - View assigned RAMS documents
- **Absence** - Request leave
- **Maintenance** - View maintenance schedules
- **Workshop** - View workshop tasks

## Management Tools (Managers/Admins Only)

If you're a Manager or Admin, you'll see a sidebar menu with:
- **Approvals** - Review submitted forms
- **Actions** - Manage defects and tasks
- **Toolbox Talks** - Send safety messages
- **Reports** - Download reports

## Admin Tools (Admins Only)

- **Users** - Manage user accounts
- **Vehicles** - Manage fleet

## Top Navigation

The top bar shows:
- **SQUIRES** logo (click to return to dashboard)
- Navigation links based on your role
- **Bell icon** - View notifications
- **Sign Out** button

articles.title: How to install the app on my phone
articles.summary: Add the Squires App to your home screen for the best mobile experience.
articles.content_md:
# How to install the app on my phone

The Squires App is a Progressive Web App (PWA) that can be installed on your phone for an app-like experience.

## iPhone (Safari)

1. Open Safari and go to https://avsworklog.mpdee.uk
2. Tap the **Share** button (square with arrow)
3. Scroll down and tap **Add to Home Screen**
4. Tap **Add** in the top right

## Android (Chrome)

1. Open Chrome and go to https://avsworklog.mpdee.uk
2. Tap the **three dots** menu in the top right
3. Tap **Add to Home screen**
4. Tap **Add**

## Benefits

- Launch directly from your home screen
- App-like full-screen experience
- Works offline for viewing previously loaded data
- Faster access without opening a browser

articles.title: What are the different user roles?
articles.summary: Explanation of Employee, Manager, and Admin roles.
articles.content_md:
# What are the different user roles?

The app has three main role types that determine what you can access:

## Employee

- Create and submit timesheets
- Perform vehicle inspections
- View and sign assigned RAMS documents
- Request absence/leave
- View maintenance schedules
- View assigned workshop tasks

## Manager

Everything an Employee can do, plus:
- Approve/reject timesheets and absences
- Review and action inspection defects
- Send Toolbox Talks and Reminders
- Download reports
- Create timesheets on behalf of employees
- View all employees' data

## Admin

Everything a Manager can do, plus:
- Create, edit, and delete user accounts
- Manage roles and permissions
- Manage vehicle fleet
- Configure system settings
- Upload and manage RAMS documents
- Edit FAQ content

## Super Admin

A special protected account (admin@mpdee.co.uk) that cannot be locked out or modified by other admins. Has full system access including developer tools.

articles.title: How do I create a new timesheet?
articles.summary: Step-by-step guide to creating and submitting a weekly timesheet.
articles.content_md:
# How do I create a new timesheet?

## Quick Steps

1. Go to **Timesheets** from the dashboard or navigation
2. Click **New Timesheet** button
3. Select the **Week Ending** date (must be a Sunday)
4. Fill in each day's hours using the day tabs (Mon-Sun)
5. Add your digital signature
6. Click **Submit**

## Entering Daily Hours

For each day:
1. Click the day tab (Mon, Tue, etc.)
2. Enter **Start Time** and **End Time**
3. The hours are calculated automatically
4. Optionally add a **Job Number**
5. Add any **Remarks** if needed

## Special Options

- **In Yard** - Mark if you worked in the yard that day
- **Did Not Work** - Mark days you didn't work (sick, leave, weekend, etc.)

## Important Rules

- All 7 days must have hours entered OR be marked as "Did Not Work"
- You cannot submit a timesheet for a week that already has one
- A digital signature is required before submission

## Saving Drafts

Click **Save Draft** at any time to save your progress without submitting. You can return later to complete and submit.

articles.title: How do I edit a timesheet?
articles.summary: Instructions for editing draft or rejected timesheets.
articles.content_md:
# How do I edit a timesheet?

## When Can I Edit?

You can only edit timesheets with these statuses:
- **Draft** - Not yet submitted
- **Rejected** - Returned by manager with comments

Approved or processed timesheets cannot be edited.

## How to Edit

1. Go to **Timesheets**
2. Find the timesheet in the list
3. Click on it to open
4. Make your changes
5. Click **Save** or **Submit**

## After Rejection

If your timesheet was rejected:
1. Read the manager's comments (shown at the top)
2. Make the requested corrections
3. Update your signature if needed
4. Re-submit the timesheet

articles.title: What do timesheet statuses mean?
articles.summary: Explanation of Draft, Submitted, Approved, Rejected, and Processed statuses.
articles.content_md:
# What do timesheet statuses mean?

## Draft

Timesheet is saved but not submitted. Only you can see it. You can continue editing.

## Submitted

Timesheet has been submitted for manager approval. You cannot edit until reviewed.

## Approved

Manager has approved the timesheet. It will be processed for payroll.

## Rejected

Manager has returned the timesheet with comments. Read the feedback, make corrections, and re-submit.

## Processed

Timesheet has been processed for payroll. This is the final status.

## Adjusted

The timesheet was adjusted after approval (rare case for corrections).

articles.title: How do I download a timesheet as PDF?
articles.summary: Instructions for downloading timesheet PDFs (managers only).
articles.content_md:
# How do I download a timesheet as PDF?

**Note:** PDF download is available to Managers and Admins only.

## From the Timesheet List

1. Go to **Timesheets**
2. Find the timesheet you want
3. Click the **Download** icon (down arrow)
4. The PDF will download to your device

## From the Timesheet Detail Page

1. Open the timesheet
2. Click the **Download PDF** button
3. The PDF will download

## What's Included

- Employee name and details
- Week ending date
- All daily entries with hours
- Total hours
- Employee signature
- Approval status and manager comments

articles.title: Can I delete a timesheet?
articles.summary: Information about deleting draft timesheets.
articles.content_md:
# Can I delete a timesheet?

## Draft Timesheets

Yes, you can delete timesheets that are still in **Draft** status:

1. Go to **Timesheets**
2. Find the draft timesheet
3. Click the **Delete** (trash) icon
4. Confirm deletion

## Submitted/Approved Timesheets

Once submitted, timesheets cannot be deleted by employees. Contact your manager if there's an issue with a submitted timesheet.

articles.title: How do I perform a vehicle inspection?
articles.summary: Step-by-step guide to completing a 26-point vehicle inspection.
articles.content_md:
# How do I perform a vehicle inspection?

## Quick Steps

1. Go to **Inspections** from the dashboard
2. Click **New Inspection**
3. Select the **Vehicle** from the dropdown
4. Enter the **Start Date** and **End Date** for the inspection period
5. Enter the current **Mileage**
6. Complete all 26 inspection items
7. Click **Submit**

## The 26-Point Checklist

For each item, you must mark it as:
- **Pass** (green tick) - Item is satisfactory
- **Fail** (red X) - Item has a defect or issue

If you mark an item as Fail, add comments explaining the defect.

## Adding Photos

For any item (especially defects):
1. Click the camera icon
2. Take a photo or choose from gallery
3. Add a caption describing the issue

## Progress Tracking

The header shows your progress (e.g., "15/26 items completed"). All 26 items must be marked before you can submit.

## Save as Draft

You can save your progress and come back later by clicking **Save Draft**.

articles.title: What happens when I report a defect?
articles.summary: How defects are tracked and actioned.
articles.content_md:
# What happens when I report a defect?

When you mark an inspection item as **Fail** (defect):

1. **Action Created** - A manager action is automatically created for the defect
2. **Priority Set** - Based on the item type, a priority is assigned (low/medium/high/urgent)
3. **Manager Notified** - The defect appears in the Actions page for managers
4. **Tracking** - The defect is tracked until resolved

## Adding Details

Always add:
- **Comments** describing the defect
- **Photos** showing the issue

This helps managers understand and action the defect quickly.

## After Submission

Managers will review the inspection and:
- Create workshop tasks if repairs needed
- Update the action status as work progresses
- Mark as complete when resolved

articles.title: What do inspection statuses mean?
articles.summary: Explanation of inspection status workflow.
articles.content_md:
# What do inspection statuses mean?

## Draft

Inspection is saved but not complete. You can continue editing.

## Submitted

Inspection is submitted and awaiting any necessary follow-up. Defects will be actioned by managers.

## Approved

Inspection has been reviewed and approved by management.

articles.title: What is RAMS?
articles.summary: Overview of the RAMS document system.
articles.content_md:
# What is RAMS?

RAMS stands for **Risk Assessment and Method Statement**. These are important safety documents that outline:

- Potential hazards for a task or site
- Safety measures and procedures
- Method of work to be followed

## Legal Requirement

RAMS documents are legally required to ensure workers understand the risks and safety procedures before starting work.

## In the App

Managers upload RAMS documents and assign them to relevant employees. You must:
1. Read the document
2. Sign to confirm you've read and understood it

You cannot proceed with certain app functions until you've signed required RAMS documents.

articles.title: How do I view and sign RAMS documents?
articles.summary: Instructions for reading and signing assigned RAMS.
articles.content_md:
# How do I view and sign RAMS documents?

## Viewing Your Assigned RAMS

1. Go to **RAMS** from the dashboard or navigation
2. You'll see a list of RAMS documents assigned to you
3. Documents show status: **Pending** (needs signing) or **Signed**

## Signing a RAMS Document

1. Click on a pending RAMS document
2. Read the document carefully (you can download the PDF)
3. Scroll to the bottom
4. Click **Sign to Confirm**
5. Your signature and timestamp are recorded

## Important

- You must read the full document before signing
- Your signature confirms you understand the content
- Signed documents remain accessible for reference

articles.title: How do visitors sign RAMS documents?
articles.summary: Recording visitor signatures for RAMS documents.
articles.content_md:
# How do visitors sign RAMS documents?

For site visitors who need to acknowledge RAMS documents but don't have app accounts:

1. Go to **RAMS**
2. Find the relevant document
3. Click **Record Visitor Signature**
4. Enter the visitor's name
5. Have them sign on the screen
6. Submit

The visitor signature is recorded against that RAMS document with timestamp.

articles.title: How do I upload RAMS documents? (Managers)
articles.summary: Instructions for uploading and assigning RAMS documents.
articles.content_md:
# How do I upload RAMS documents? (Managers)

**Note:** This is for Managers and Admins only.

## Uploading a New RAMS

1. Go to **RAMS**
2. Click **Manage RAMS** (gear icon)
3. Click **Upload New RAMS**
4. Fill in:
   - **Title** - Clear name for the document
   - **Description** - Brief summary
   - **PDF File** - The RAMS document (PDF format)
5. Click **Upload**

## Assigning to Employees

1. Find the RAMS in the list
2. Click **Assign Employees**
3. Select the employees who need to sign
4. Click **Assign**

Assigned employees will see the document in their RAMS page and receive a notification.

articles.title: How do I request absence/leave?
articles.summary: Instructions for submitting an absence request.
articles.content_md:
# How do I request absence/leave?

## Quick Steps

1. Go to **Absence** from the dashboard
2. Click **Request Absence** button
3. Fill in:
   - **Type/Reason** - Select from dropdown (Holiday, Sick, etc.)
   - **Start Date** - First day of absence
   - **End Date** - Last day of absence
   - **Notes** - Any additional information
4. Click **Submit Request**

## What Happens Next

- Your request status will show as **Pending**
- Managers are notified to review
- Once reviewed, status changes to **Approved** or **Rejected**
- You'll receive a notification of the decision

## Calendar View

The Absence page shows a calendar with:
- Your approved absences
- Pending requests
- Team absences (if manager)

articles.title: How do I cancel an absence request?
articles.summary: Instructions for cancelling a pending or approved absence.
articles.content_md:
# How do I cancel an absence request?

## Cancelling a Pending Request

If your request hasn't been reviewed yet:
1. Go to **Absence**
2. Find your pending request
3. Click **Cancel**
4. Confirm cancellation

## After Approval

If already approved, contact your manager to cancel the absence.

articles.title: How do I manage absence settings? (Managers)
articles.summary: Configure absence reasons and allowances.
articles.content_md:
# How do I manage absence settings? (Managers)

**Note:** This is for Managers and Admins only.

## Accessing Settings

1. Go to **Absence**
2. Click **Manage** button or gear icon

## Absence Reasons

Configure the types of absence available:
- Go to **Manage** â†’ **Reasons**
- Add, edit, or remove absence types
- Mark reasons as requiring manager approval

## Employee Allowances

Set leave allowances:
- Go to **Manage** â†’ **Allowances**

- Track used vs remaining days

articles.title: How do I view vehicle maintenance schedules?
articles.summary: Understanding the fleet maintenance overview.

articles.title: How do I configure maintenance settings? (Managers)
articles.summary: Configure warning thresholds and notification recipients.
articles.content_md:
# How do I configure maintenance settings? (Managers)

**Note:** Settings are for Managers and Admins only.

## Accessing Settings

1. Go to **Fleet** â†’ **Settings** tab

## Warning Periods

Set how far in advance warnings appear:
- **MOT Warning** - Days before MOT expires to show warning
- **Tax Warning** - Days before tax expires
- **Service Warning** - Miles or days before service due

Configure who receives email alerts:

articles.title: How do I manage the vehicle fleet? (Admin)
articles.summary: Add, edit, and organize vehicles.
articles.content_md:
# How do I manage the vehicle fleet? (Admin)

**Note:** This is for Admins only.

## Accessing Vehicle Management

1. Go to **Fleet** â†’ **Vehicles** tab
2. Or click **Vehicles** in the admin sidebar

## Adding a Vehicle

1. Click **Add Vehicle**
2. Enter:
   - **Registration Number** - The vehicle reg
   - **Nickname** - Optional friendly name
   - **Category** - Vehicle type (Van, Truck, etc.)
3. Save

## Editing a Vehicle

1. Click the edit icon on a vehicle row
2. Update details
3. Save changes

## Vehicle Categories

Manage categories:
1. Click **Categories** tab or button
2. Add/edit/delete categories
3. Categories help organize the fleet

## Archiving Vehicles

Vehicles no longer in use can be archived rather than deleted, preserving history.

articles.title: How do I view workshop tasks?
articles.summary: Understanding the workshop tasks page.
articles.content_md:
# How do I view workshop tasks?

## Accessing Workshop Tasks

Click **Workshop** from the dashboard or navigation.

## What You'll See

A list of workshop tasks showing:
- **Vehicle** - Registration and nickname
- **Task Description** - What work is needed
- **Category** - Type of work (e.g., Repairs, Service)
- **Status** - Current state of the task
- **Priority** - Urgency level

## Task Statuses

- **Pending** - Not yet started
- **Logged** - Acknowledged, waiting for parts/scheduling
- **In Progress** - Work underway
- **On Hold** - Paused (waiting for parts, etc.)
- **Completed** - Work finished

## Filtering

Use filters to find tasks:
- By status (Pending, In Progress, etc.)
- By vehicle

articles.title: How do I create a workshop task? (Managers)
articles.summary: Creating manual workshop tasks.
articles.content_md:
# How do I create a workshop task? (Managers)

**Note:** Managers and Admins can create tasks. Tasks are also auto-created from inspection defects.

## Manual Task Creation

1. Go to **Workshop Tasks**
2. Click **Add Task** button
3. Fill in:
   - **Vehicle** - Select the vehicle
   - **Category** - Type of work
   - **Description** - What needs doing
   - **Mileage** - Current vehicle mileage (optional)
4. Click **Create Task**

## Automatic Tasks

When a vehicle inspection has defects, workshop tasks are automatically created so the issues can be tracked and resolved.

articles.title: How do I update a workshop task status?
articles.summary: Changing task status and adding completion details.
articles.content_md:
# How do I update a workshop task status?

## Updating Status

1. Go to **Workshop Tasks**
2. Find the task
3. Click the status action button:
   - **Log** - Mark as logged (acknowledged)
   - **Start** - Mark as in progress
   - **Hold** - Put on hold
   - **Complete** - Mark as finished

## Adding Comments

Click the comment icon on a task to:
- Add notes about progress
- Record parts ordered
- Document work done

## Marking Complete

When marking a task complete:
1. Click **Complete**
2. Add completion notes (what was done)
3. Enter final mileage if applicable
4. Confirm completion

Completed tasks move to the "Completed" filter view.

articles.title: How do I manage workshop categories? (Managers)
articles.summary: Configure task categories and subcategories.
articles.content_md:
# How do I manage workshop categories? (Managers)

**Note:** This is for Managers and Admins only.

## Accessing Settings

1. Go to **Workshop Tasks**
2. Click the **Settings** (gear) icon

## Managing Categories

- **Add Category** - Create new task category
- **Edit** - Change category name
- **Reorder** - Drag to change sort order
- **Deactivate** - Hide category without deleting

## Subcategories

Each category can have subcategories for more specific task types:
1. Click on a category
2. Add subcategories as needed
3. Subcategories appear as options when creating tasks

articles.title: How do I review and approve submissions? (Managers)
articles.summary: Overview of the approvals page for managers.
articles.content_md:
# How do I review and approve submissions? (Managers)

**Note:** This is for Managers and Admins only.

## Accessing Approvals

Click **Approvals** in the sidebar menu.

## Tabs

The page has tabs for different submission types:
- **Timesheets** - Employee timesheet submissions
- **Absences** - Leave requests

## Filtering

Filter submissions by status:
- **Pending** - Waiting for your review
- **Approved** - Already approved
- **Rejected** - Already rejected
- **All** - View everything

## Quick Actions

From the list view:
- Click **Approve** to approve immediately
- Click **Reject** to reject (opens comment dialog)
- Click on a row to view full details

articles.title: How do I approve or reject a timesheet?
articles.summary: Step-by-step timesheet approval process.
articles.content_md:
# How do I approve or reject a timesheet?

## Quick Approval

1. Go to **Approvals** â†’ **Timesheets** tab
2. Find the pending timesheet
3. Click **Approve** button

## Rejection with Comments

1. Find the timesheet
2. Click **Reject**
3. Enter comments explaining what needs correction
4. Confirm rejection

The employee will be notified and can edit and resubmit.

## Detailed Review

1. Click on the timesheet row to open details
2. Review:
   - Daily hours and entries
   - Job numbers
   - Employee signature
3. Approve or reject from the detail view

## Download PDF

From the list or detail view, click the download icon to get a PDF copy.

articles.title: How do I approve or reject absence requests?
articles.summary: Processing leave requests.
articles.content_md:
# How do I approve or reject absence requests?

## Quick Steps

1. Go to **Approvals** â†’ **Absences** tab
2. Review pending requests
3. Click **Approve** or **Reject**

## Information Shown

- Employee name
- Absence type (Holiday, Sick, etc.)
- Dates and duration
- Any notes from the employee

## Rejection

When rejecting:
1. Click **Reject**
2. Add a reason or comments
3. Confirm

The employee will be notified of the decision.

articles.title: What is the Actions page?
articles.summary: Overview of manager actions and defect tracking.
articles.content_md:
# What is the Actions page?

**Note:** This is for Managers and Admins only.

## Purpose

The Actions page tracks items requiring manager attention:
- **Inspection Defects** - Issues found during vehicle inspections
- **Maintenance Alerts** - Overdue or due soon maintenance items

## Accessing Actions

Click **Actions** in the sidebar menu.

## What You'll See

- **Summary cards** - Counts of overdue/due soon maintenance
- **Action list** - All tracked actions with:
  - Title and description
  - Related vehicle and inspection
  - Priority level
  - Current status

articles.title: How do I manage actions?
articles.summary: Updating action status and creating workshop tasks.
articles.content_md:
# How do I manage actions?

## Action Statuses

- **Pending** - New, not yet addressed
- **Logged** - Acknowledged, being worked on
- **Completed** - Resolved

## Updating an Action

1. Find the action in the list
2. Click **Mark Logged** to acknowledge
3. Add notes about what's being done
4. Click **Mark Complete** when resolved

## Creating Workshop Tasks

For defects requiring repair:
1. Click **Create Workshop Task** on the action
2. A new workshop task is created linked to this action
3. Track the repair through Workshop Tasks

## Reverting Status

If needed, you can revert a completed action back to pending.

articles.title: What are Toolbox Talks?
articles.summary: Overview of the messaging system for safety communications.
articles.content_md:
# What are Toolbox Talks?

**Note:** Sending is for Managers and Admins only. All employees can receive.

## Purpose

Toolbox Talks are important safety messages that:
- Communicate critical safety information
- Require employee acknowledgment
- Create a record of who has read and understood the message

## Types of Messages

### Toolbox Talk (High Priority)
- **Blocking** - Employees cannot use the app until signed
- Requires digital signature to acknowledge
- Used for critical safety information

### Reminder (Low Priority)
- **Non-blocking** - Employees can dismiss after reading
- General information or updates
- No signature required

articles.title: How do I send a Toolbox Talk?
articles.summary: Creating and sending important safety messages.
articles.content_md:
# How do I send a Toolbox Talk?

**Note:** This is for Managers and Admins only.

## Steps

1. Go to **Toolbox Talks** from the sidebar
2. Click **Create Toolbox Talk** tab
3. Fill in:
   - **Title** - Clear, descriptive title
   - **Message** - Full content of the talk
   - **Recipients** - Select employees or "All Employees"
4. Click **Send**

## After Sending

- Recipients receive a notification
- They must sign to acknowledge
- They cannot use the app until signed
- Track signatures in the Reports tab

articles.title: How do I send a Reminder?
articles.summary: Creating and sending low-priority reminder messages.
articles.content_md:
# How do I send a Reminder?

**Note:** This is for Managers and Admins only.

## Steps

1. Go to **Toolbox Talks** from the sidebar
2. Click **Create Reminder** tab
3. Fill in:
   - **Title** - Brief title
   - **Message** - Content
   - **Recipients** - Select employees
4. Click **Send**

## Difference from Toolbox Talk

Reminders are:
- Non-blocking (employees can dismiss)
- Lower priority
- No signature required
- Good for general updates and announcements

articles.title: How do I track Toolbox Talk signatures?
articles.summary: Viewing who has signed Toolbox Talks.
articles.content_md:
# How do I track Toolbox Talk signatures?

**Note:** This is for Managers and Admins only.

## Accessing Reports

1. Go to **Toolbox Talks**
2. Click the **Reports** tab

## What You'll See

- List of sent Toolbox Talks and Reminders
- For each message:
  - Total recipients
  - Signed count
  - Pending count
  - Individual recipient status

## Checking Compliance

Expand a message to see:
- Who has signed (with timestamp)
- Who is still pending

Follow up with employees who haven't signed required Toolbox Talks.

articles.title: How do I download reports?
articles.summary: Overview of available reports and exports.
articles.content_md:
# How do I download reports?

**Note:** This is for Managers and Admins only.

## Accessing Reports

Click **Reports** in the sidebar menu.

## Available Reports

### Timesheets Tab
- **Excel Export** - All timesheets for date range
- **PDF Export** - Individual or bulk PDFs
- **Summary Report** - Hours by employee

### Inspections Tab
- **Excel Export** - All inspections for date range
- **Defects Report** - List of reported defects

## Setting Date Range

1. Set **From** date
2. Set **To** date
3. Or click quick buttons:
   - **Last Week**
   - **Last Month**

## Downloading

1. Set your date range
2. Click the download button for the report you want
3. File downloads to your device

articles.title: How do I bulk download PDFs?
articles.summary: Downloading multiple timesheets as PDFs.
articles.content_md:
# How do I bulk download PDFs?

**Note:** This is for Managers and Admins only.

## Steps

1. Go to **Reports** â†’ **Timesheets** tab
2. Set your date range
3. Click **Bulk Download PDFs**
4. Wait for progress to complete
5. A ZIP file downloads containing all PDFs

## Large Downloads

For many timesheets:

## Use Cases

articles.title: How do I manage users? (Admin)
articles.summary: Overview of user administration.
articles.content_md:
# How do I manage users? (Admin)

**Note:** This is for Admins only.

## Accessing User Management

Click **Users** in the admin sidebar.

## Users Tab

View all users with:
- Name and email
- Employee ID
- Role
- Creation date

## Filter by Role

Click the stat cards to filter:
- All Users
- Admins
- Managers
- Employees

## Actions

For each user:
- **Edit** - Update details
- **Reset Password** - Generate new password
- **Delete** - Remove user (with data options)

articles.title: How do I create a new user?
articles.summary: Adding new user accounts.
articles.content_md:
# How do I create a new user?

**Note:** This is for Admins only.

## Steps

1. Go to **Users**
2. Click **Add User**
3. Fill in:
   - **Email** (required) - Their login email
   - **Full Name** (required)
   - **Phone Number** (optional)
   - **Employee ID** (optional)
   - **Role** (required) - Select their role
4. Click **Create User**

## Temporary Password

A temporary password is:
- Automatically generated
- Sent to their email
- Displayed to you (copy it if email fails)
- Must be changed on first login

articles.title: How do I reset a user's password?
articles.summary: Generating a new password for a user.
articles.content_md:
# How do I reset a user's password?

**Note:** This is for Admins only.

## Steps

1. Go to **Users**
2. Find the user
3. Click the **Reset Password** (key icon)
4. Confirm the reset
5. New password is:
   - Generated automatically
   - Emailed to the user
   - Displayed to you to share manually if needed

## After Reset

The user must change the password on their next login.

## Super Admin

The super admin password cannot be reset by other admins.

articles.title: How do I delete a user?
articles.summary: Removing user accounts and data options.
articles.content_md:
# How do I delete a user?

**Note:** This is for Admins only.

## Steps

1. Go to **Users**
2. Find the user
3. Click **Delete** (trash icon)
4. Choose deletion mode:

### Keep Company Data (Recommended)
- Personal account deleted
- Timesheets, inspections preserved
- User shown as "Name (Deleted User)" in records
- Maintains audit trail

### Delete All User Data
- Everything deleted permanently
- Affects historical reports
- Cannot be undone

5. Confirm deletion

## Restrictions

- Cannot delete yourself
- Cannot delete super admin account

articles.title: How do roles and permissions work?
articles.summary: Understanding the role-based access control system.
articles.content_md:
# How do roles and permissions work?

## The System

Squires uses Role-Based Access Control (RBAC):
- **Roles** define job types (Admin, Manager, Employee-Civils, etc.)
- **Permissions** control which modules each role can access

## Module Permissions

Each role can have access to:
- Timesheets
- Inspections
- RAMS
- Absence
- Maintenance
- Toolbox Talks
- Workshop Tasks
- Approvals (manager)
- Actions (manager)
- Reports (manager)
- User Management (admin)
- Vehicle Management (admin)

## Role Types

### Manager/Admin Roles
Automatically have full access to all modules.

### Employee Roles
Access controlled by individual permissions. Can be customized per role.

articles.title: How do I manage roles? (Admin)
articles.summary: Creating and configuring roles.
articles.content_md:
# How do I manage roles? (Admin)

**Note:** This is for Admins only.

## Accessing Roles

1. Go to **Users**
2. Click the **Roles** tab

## Viewing Roles

See all roles with:
- Name and description
- User count (how many users have this role)
- Permission count (modules enabled)

## Creating a New Role

1. Click **Add Role**
2. Enter:
   - **Name** (internal identifier)
   - **Display Name** (shown in UI)
   - **Description** (optional)
   - **Is Manager/Admin** - Toggle if role should have full access
3. Save the role
4. Configure permissions

## Editing Permissions

1. Click on a role
2. Toggle modules on/off
3. Save changes

## Default Permissions

New roles default to employee modules enabled:
- Timesheets, Inspections, RAMS, Absence, Toolbox Talks

articles.title: What roles cannot be modified?
articles.summary: Understanding protected system roles.
articles.content_md:
# What roles cannot be modified?

## Protected Roles

Some roles have restrictions:

### Super Admin
- Cannot be edited or deleted
- Only admin@mpdee.co.uk has this
- Cannot be locked out
- Has all permissions always

### Admin & Manager
- Core permissions cannot be disabled
- Always have full module access
- Cannot be demoted below manager level

## Role Deletion

A role cannot be deleted if:
- Users are still assigned to it
- Reassign users first, then delete the role

articles.title: How do notifications work?
articles.summary: Understanding the notification system.
articles.content_md:
# How do notifications work?

## The Bell Icon

Click the bell in the top navigation to see notifications.

## Types of Notifications

- **Toolbox Talks** - New safety messages requiring signature
- **Reminders** - Informational messages
- **Approval Updates** - When your submissions are approved/rejected

## Notification Badge

The red number on the bell shows unread notifications.

## Clearing Notifications

Click on a notification to:
- View the full content
- Mark as read
- Take action (e.g., sign Toolbox Talk)

articles.title: The app won't load - what should I do?
articles.summary: Troubleshooting loading issues.
articles.content_md:
# The app won't load - what should I do?

## Basic Steps

1. **Check internet connection** - Ensure you have WiFi or mobile data
2. **Refresh the page** - Pull down to refresh (mobile) or press F5 (desktop)
3. **Clear browser cache** - In browser settings, clear cached data
4. **Try a different browser** - Chrome or Safari recommended

## PWA Issues

If using the installed app:
1. Delete the app from home screen
2. Clear browser cache
3. Revisit the website
4. Re-add to home screen

## Still Not Working?

Contact your administrator with:
- What you were trying to do
- Any error messages shown
- Your device type and browser

articles.title: I can't log in - what should I do?
articles.summary: Troubleshooting login problems.
articles.content_md:
# I can't log in - what should I do?

## Check Credentials

- **Email** - Make sure it's your work email (correctly spelled)
- **Password** - Check caps lock, try typing in a text field first

## Forgot Password?

Contact your administrator - they can reset it from User Management.

## Account Locked?

If you've tried too many times, wait a few minutes before trying again.

## New Account?

If you just joined:
- Check your email for welcome message with temporary password
- Password must be changed on first login

## Still Not Working?

Ask your administrator to:
- Verify your account exists
- Reset your password
- Check your role permissions

articles.title: My data isn't saving - what's wrong?
articles.summary: Troubleshooting data save issues.
articles.content_md:
# My data isn't saving - what's wrong?

## Check Connection

You need internet to save data. Check:
- WiFi or mobile data is active
- You're not in airplane mode

## Required Fields

Make sure all required fields are filled:
- Look for error messages in red
- Required fields are marked with *

## Session Expired

If you've been idle too long:
- You may need to log in again
- Try refreshing and logging back in

## Offline Mode

If you're offline:
- Changes queue automatically
- Sync when back online
- Don't close the app until synced

## Try Again

1. Refresh the page
2. Re-enter the data
3. Click save again
4. If still failing, note any error message and contact admin

articles.title: I'm getting 'Access Denied' - why?
articles.summary: Understanding permission errors.
articles.content_md:
# I'm getting 'Access Denied' - why?

## Role Permissions

You may not have permission for that feature:
- Your role determines what you can access
- Ask your admin if you need access

## Manager-Only Features

Some features are only for managers:
- Approvals
- Actions
- Toolbox Talks (sending)
- Reports

## Admin-Only Features

- User Management
- Role Management
- Vehicle Management
- FAQ Editor

## What To Do

1. Check if the feature is appropriate for your role
2. Contact your administrator if you need access
3. They can update your role permissions
